p: A recent research reported that SARS-Cov-2-infected patients with diabetes were at a higher risk of developing severe pneumonia with uncontrolled inflammatory responses and hypercoagulable state associated with dysregulation of glucose metabolism compared with Covid-19 individuals without DM ( Guo et al., 2020). Furthermore, serum levels of inflammatory mediators, including IL-6 and C-reactive protein, were remarkably increased compared to those in nondiabetic patients, suggesting that diabetic patients are more vulnerable to the high inflammatory wave leading to rapid deterioration ( Guo et al., 2020). Individuals with diabetes mellitus and severe obesity (BMI ≥40 kg/m 2) are more likely to be infected and are at a higher risk for complications and death from Covid-19 ( Muniyappa and Gubbi, 2020).
